Title: Series: Library of Ashurbanipal
Description: Upper part of a clay tablet, describing Ashurbanipal's campaigns in Egypt and reception of an embassy, end of obverse and beginning of reverse are wanting, and on both sides very large pieces out of the middle are broken out; the lines are, moreover, on many passages either mutilated or obliterated, Neo-Assyrian.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Austen Henry Layard (et al)
Curator's comments: On reverse lines 2-11 see Schrader, E., 1883. ‘Keilinschriften und das Alte Testament II: (2nd ed.), p. 450 f. Cf. also Bezold, in Smith, S.A., 1887-1889. 3 vols. ‘Die Keilschrifttexte Asurbanipals, Königs von Assyrien, 668-626 v. Chr / nach dem selbst in London copirten Grundtext, mit Transscription, Übersetzung, Kommentar und vollständigem Glossar’. Leipzig : E. Pfeiffer, part 3; and Tiele, C.P. 1886. ‘Babylonisch-assyrische Geschichte’ I. Gotha : Friedrich Andreas Perthes, p. 372.
Bibliographic references: Bezold 1889a / Catalogue of the cuneiform tablets in the Kouyunjik Collection of the British Museum (p.60)
Rawlinson H C & Smith G 1870a / The cuneiform inscriptions of Western Asia, III (28 f)
Smith 1871 / History of Assurbanipal, translated from Cuneiform Inscriptions (pp.36 ff, 55 ff, 80 ff, 73 ff)
